interestRateConverterPage.title: Monthly and Annual Interest Rate Converter
interestRateConverterPage.metaDescription: Convert monthly interest rates to annual and annual to monthly using compound interest. Free and accurate tool.
interestRateConverterPage.intro: Convert monthly interest rates to annual rates and annual rates to monthly rates automatically and accurately using compound interest ‚Äî the same method used by banks and financial institutions. This converter is ideal for comparing mortgages, investments, rents, loans, and any contract using interest rates over different periods. Simply enter the rate in one field to instantly see the equivalent rate for the other period, without manual calculations or incorrect approximations.
interestRateConverterPage.supportingText: Unlike simplified conversions that merely multiply or divide the rate by 12, this tool considers the real effect of compound capitalization, ensuring correct and reliable results. For example, a 1% monthly rate is not equivalent to 12% per year, but rather 12.6825% per year. If you are analyzing a mortgage, rent adjustment, investment return, or any financial simulation, this converter helps standardize rates and make more informed decisions.
interestRateConverterPage.educationalNote: Note: Conversions use compound interest. A monthly rate of 1% is not equivalent to 12% per year.

items.question: How to convert monthly interest to annual?
items.answer: The compound interest formula is used, raising the monthly rate to the 12th power to get the effective annual rate: i_a = (1 + i_m)^12 - 1.

items.question: Does this converter use simple interest?
items.answer: No. All conversions use compound interest, reflecting real financial market practices.

ipca.title: IPCA ‚Äì Broad National Consumer Price Index | Complete History and Analysis
ipca.description: The IPCA (Broad National Consumer Price Index) is Brazil's main official inflation indicator, calculated and released monthly by IBGE. It measures the price variation of goods and services consumed by Brazilian families and is widely used as a reference for monetary policy, contract adjustments, rents, salaries, benefits, investments, and long-term economic analysis.
ipca.pageDescription: On this page of Kitnets.com, you can follow the complete history of IPCA from January 1995 to the current date, with reliable, organized, and easy-to-analyze data.

sections.title: What you find on this page

items.title: Monthly IPCA variation
items.text: Track how much inflation has varied each month over the years.

items.title: IPCA accumulated in 12 months
items.text: Essential indicator for rent adjustments, contracts, and value corrections.

items.title: Interactive historical chart
items.text: Visualize the evolution of Brazilian inflation over time and identify economic cycles, periods of high inflation, and slowdowns.

items.title: Monthly heatmap
items.text: Visual analysis showing IPCA behavior month by month, facilitating comparison between years and identification of seasonal patterns.

items.title: Detailed historical data table
items.text: Month-by-month values, with monthly index and 12-month accumulated, ideal for studies, simulations, and financial analysis.

items.title: Custom period filter
items.text: Consult any date range between 01/01/1995 and the most recent month available, allowing for complete historical analyses or focus on specific periods.

sections.title: Why is IPCA important for the real estate market?
sections.text: IPCA is one of the main indices used as a basis for rent adjustments, especially in contracts seeking to preserve purchasing power over time. For owners, investors, and tenants, following IPCA helps to:
list: Understand the loss or preservation of purchasing power
Evaluate if an adjustment is fair and aligned with inflation
Compare IPCA with other indices like IGP-M, INPC, and IVAR
Make more informed decisions about real estate investments

sections.title: Official source and reliable data
sections.text: All data presented on this page is sourced from IBGE, ensuring credibility, precision, and constant updates.

ipca.closing: Kitnets.com offers clear and accessible tools for anyone wanting to understand the real economy, protect their assets from inflation, and make better decisions in the Brazilian real estate market.
ipca.cta: Follow the IPCA, compare periods, analyze trends, and use inflation to your advantage.
